title: Tobacco wars escalate with Huntingdale arson attack | 7NEWS
description: A tobacco store in Huntingdale, Western Australia, was destroyed in a suspected arson attack at 3:15am, marking the latest incident in an escalating series of tobacco-related crimes across the state. The attack caused collateral damage to neighbouring businesses, cutting power and disrupting operations, while police investigate a potential link to a burnt-out car found 10 kilometres away in Forestdale. The incident has intensified calls for the WA government to recall parliament early and introduce tougher penalties similar to Victoria's laws, which allow fines exceeding $1.8 million compared to WA's current $80,000 maximum. title: Man sustains serious burns after car inferno; Use of Craig Silvey's texts suspended | 7NEWS Perth
description: Police say the driver allegedly doused himself with accelerant before officers negotiated and arrested him, and the vehicle exploded into flames. Australian author Craig Silvey;s texts have been either suspended or cancelled from school curriculum, film screenings, and more as he faces child exploitation charges. title: US withdraws troops from Qatar base amid Iran tensions | 7NEWS
description: The United States is withdrawing troops from Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, its largest military installation in the Middle East housing approximately 10,000 personnel, amid escalating tensions with Iran. The UK has followed with its own withdrawal of about 1,000 staff from the same base, which was previously struck during a 12-day conflict in June. Tehran has warned that any American military strike would be met with serious retaliation, while Iranian state television broadcasts carefully staged funeral processions contrasting sharply with reports of mounting casualties and a communications blackout. title: Wild police chase ends in Greenacre crash | 7NEWS
description: A police pursuit in Western Sydney ended with a black Holden hatchback ramming a police vehicle before crashing into a parked car at Greenacre just before midnight. Raptor squad officers arrested a 27-year-old woman at the scene, while the driver of the Holden remains at large. The pursuit began after the vehicle was spotted driving at high speed. title: Queensland floods threaten Rockhampton after Clermont devastation | 7NEWS
description: Floodwaters are moving southward towards Rockhampton in Queensland, following severe flooding in Clermont two days earlier that left the town covered in mud. Water levels rose dramatically from 30 centimetres to 1.5 metres in previously unaffected areas. Stock losses across western Queensland have exceeded 50,000 animals. title: Bondi terror attack memorial decision pending | 7NEWS
description: Waverley Council will meet to decide the future of the northern footbridge at Bondi Beach, where a terror attack occurred last month. NSW Premier Chris Minns supports removing the bridge, calling it a 'ghoulish reminder' of the attack, while council has commissioned a report noting both footbridges are at the end of their operational lives. Victims' families and the Jewish community will be consulted in the decision-making process. title: Identities of school students compromised in cyber attack
description: The identities of hundreds of thousands of Victorian school students have been compromised after a cyber-attack gave a third-party access to sensitive information. #cyberattack #hack #school #victoria #educationdepartment

title: Labor's proposed hate speech laws scrutinised
description: The Opposition, as well as Jewish, Christian and Muslim faith leaders have voiced their concern over the government's proposed new hate speech and gun laws. #hatespeech #law #legislation #auspol #politics

title: US pulls troops out of key Middle East bases
description: The US has begun pulling troops from bases across the Middle East, including the Al Udeid base in Qatar, as diplomacy breaks down with Iran. #iran #america #usa #military #usmilitary

title: Car rammed after police pursuit in Sydney's west
description: A 27-year-old woman has been arrested, and a man is on the run after a police pursuit in Greenacre in western Sydney. #pursuit #police #nswpolice #sydney #greenacre

title: Japanese and South Korean leaders play drums after meeting
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and South Korean President Lee Jae Myung have jammed out together on the drums to KPop Demon Hunters' hit song 'Golden', following a summit meeting. #drums #jamsession #music #kpop #japan

title: Diver missing in Antarctic waters
description: A man has disappeared while on a routine dive in Antarctica. #antarctica #diver #missing #adelieland #french

title: Waverley Council to debate response to Bondi Beach terror attack
description: Waverley Council is meeting to decide its response to the Bondi Beach terror attack. #waverleycouncil #bondi #bondibeach #sydney

title: 'Killing has stopped' in Iran, US President Donald Trump says
description: "The killing has stopped" in Iran according to "important sources", Donald Trump says. The US president says he believes there are currently no plans for large-scale executions, also not ruling out military action. At least 2500 people have been killed in Iran since citizens began protesting against the government and economic crisis, according to Human Rights Activists News Agency. #trump #donaldtrump #iran #protest #middleeast
